result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra L Zevalkink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber. Release for Standard Conditions, work, treatment, childcare. Sentence credit of 4 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

May terminate probation early after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Cassandra L Zevalkink in court with attorney Glenn Gaskill.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court will reject the amended information and vacate the finding of guilt on Count # 1 in the information, reinstate Count # 2. Court conducts plea colloquy. Defendant pleads guilty to Count # 2 of the information. Court finds defendant guilty of Count # 2. Counts # 1 and 3 are dismissed and read-in. State makes recommendations. Attorney Gaskill makes statements. Defendant makes statements.

The Court Orders the Following for Count # 2:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

60 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS for work, treatment, childcare.  (Credit - 4 days).  STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year (Early termination of probation possible at 6 months.)

Conditions of Probation:
	
-AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

-Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

-No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Cash bail to be applied to DNA surcharge and costs.
